content.description:
Pliny Helps Firmus

Municepsmuniceps, -cipis, n.: fellow citizen tu meus et condiscipuluscondiscipulus, -i, m.: fellow student et ab ineunteineo, -ire = incipio, -ere aetate 
contubernaliscontubernalis, -is, m.: fellow soldier, pater tuus et matri et avunculo meo et 
mihi familiarisfamiliaris, -e, adj. = amicus, -a, -um erat: magnae causae, cur susciperesuscipio, -ere = incipio, -ere augereaugeo, -ere: to increase 
dignitatemdignitas, -atis, f.: dignity tuam debeam.
content.question: In line 1, what does aetate mean?

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
